messages.subject: Unsuited for Unschooling was my rambling
messages.msgSnippet: Pat:  This is meant in the nicest, gentlest possible way.. but maybe you re too scared to let go of control and see what happens.  I know what that feeling is
messages.messageBody:
Pat: This is meant in the nicest, gentlest possible way.. but maybe you're
too scared to let go of control and see what happens. I know what that
feeling is like. Having grown up in an alcoholic family (I'm not suggesting
you did) I find control of everything to have been a big issue for me. I
think that's why unschooling has presented itself into my life. It's given
me a "real" opportunity to let go and trust that I'm not in charge and that
both my boys are going to be ok. I've been really listening to people who
have a lot of experience and have been doing this for a while so that I can
get centered and say to myself "ok it's me that's wanting to control
everything and I have to be the one to trust in my kids and the process"....
I hope you decide to give it a try.... However I realize it's out of my
control.....

Dawn

But they've got to have stuff to integrate, first, for those days

to be good

> ones.

Thanks for all the ideas Pam but I'm beginning to feel that

unschooling is just too hard for me. I feel very overwhelmed by all

the changes that have taken place since starting homeschooling this

fall. Maybe I'm just not suited for it.

Pat

********************
Dawn Falbe

"The people who get on in this world are people who get up and look for the
circumstances they want, and, if they can't find them, make them." - George
Bernard Shaw
"The only time my education was interrupted was when I was in school" -
George Bernard Shaw
